snippet.title: Woman mauled to death by dog in Perth
snippet.content:
A WOMAN has been mauled to death by a dog in Perth. Reports suggest the attack happened in Southern River, a residential suburb in the West Australian city. The woman is believed to be aged in her 50s. The reports police got a call about 1.30pm yesterday to a property that is a boarding kennel for dogs. St John Ambulance officers declared the woman dead after she received life threatening injuries as a result of the dog attack.
A woman aged in her fifties has died after she was mauled by a dog at Southern River, south of Perth.
Gosnells Council has seized the dog. reports the death is not being treated as suspicious and a report is being prepared for the coroner. News.com.au has contacted Gosnells Council for comment. More to come. Originally published as
